cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving generally north toward the Florida Panhandle and expected to arc northeast inland across Alabama into western and northern Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle near Panama City / Apalachicola

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Navarre, FL to the Wakulla/Jefferson County line, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle and Big Bend, then inland across Alabama and Georgia
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty easterly winds 25–35 mph possible as Fred’s remnants pass inland west of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Georgia coast because Fred makes landfall on the Gulf side and weakens inland.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could drop 1–3 inches of rain with isolated heavier pockets Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk over southeast Georgia as the system moves inland.
